intro: Lastrea standishii, commonly known as the Cape Town daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
